results.title: If Trump broke a law on the removal of official records, would he be barred from future office?
results.abstract: An obscure criminal law bars the removal of official records, on penalty of disqualification from holding any federal office. But it may not play out that way.

media.caption: Boxes were moved out of the Eisenhower Executive Office building inside the White House complex near the end of President Donald J. Trump’s term.

results.abstract: In a quest to explore her own sexuality, Nona Willis Aronowitz hit the sheets — and the books.

results.byline: By Daniel Victor and Jesus Jiménez
results.title: ‘Hamilton’ Team Protests After Church Production Adds Christian Themes
results.abstract: A church in Texas changed several lyrics in its unauthorized staging of the megahit musical, softening language and inserting religious messages.

results.title: Olivia Newton-John, Pop Singer and ‘Grease’ Star, Dies at 73
results.abstract: She amassed No. 1 hits, chart-topping albums and four records that sold more than two million copies each. More than anything else, she was likable, even beloved.

media.caption: Olivia Newton-John starring as Sandy in the 1978 hit movie “Grease.” She was a four-time Grammy winner, beguiling listeners with a high, supple, vibrato-warmed voice.
media.copyright: CBS, via Getty Images

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Rhythm and Blues (Music);Pop and Rock Music;Dozier, Lamont;Holland, Brian (1941- );Holland, Eddie Jr (1939- );Motown Records
results.title: Lamont Dozier, Writer of Numerous Motown Hits, Dies at 81
results.abstract: With the brothers Brian and Eddie Holland, Mr. Dozier wrote dozens of singles that reached the pop or R&B charts, including “You Can’t Hurry Love,” by the Supremes.

media.caption: The Motown songwriter and producer Lamont Dozier in 1969. He helped write dozens of Motown classics. Between 1963 and 1972, he and his partners, Brian and Eddie Holland, were responsible for more than 80 singles that hit the Top 40 of the pop or R&B charts.
media.copyright: Michael Ochs Archives, via Getty Images

results.title: Issey Miyake, Who Opened a Door for Japanese Fashion, Dies at 84
results.abstract: The first Japanese designer to show in Paris, he was known for his origami-like designs, creating pleated skirts, dresses and trousers that afforded freedom.

media.caption: Issey Miyake in 1991 after presenting his collection in Paris. “I don’t make fashion. I make clothes,” he once said.

results.adx_keywords: Propaganda;United States International Relations;Xi Jinping;Communist Party of China;China;Taiwan
results.title: Why China’s Confidence Could Turn Out to Be a Weakness
results.abstract: State propaganda about China’s rise is stoking extreme nationalism. That could blind China to its problems, and could lead to conflict — perhaps over Taiwan.

media.caption: Xi Jinping has declared that China is rising while “the West is declining.” Chinese state media have spread a similar message.
media.copyright: Li Gang/Xinhua, via Associated Press
